meanings.definition: Lift or haul with great effort
meanings.sent1: She had to heave the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The workers heave the fishing nets out of the water every morning.
meanings.sent3: Trying to heave the suitcase up the stairs, she almost lost her balance.
meanings.sent4: With a mighty heave, the weightlifter lifted the barbell above his head.
meanings.sent5: The sailors heave the anchor up from the seabed with all their strength.

meanings.sent1: The chest heaves with each deep breath she takes.
meanings.sent2: The boat heaves gently on the calm waves of the lake.
meanings.sent3: The old wooden floorboards heave under the weight of the dancing children.
meanings.sent4: The hot air balloons heave upwards as they are filled with gas.
meanings.sent5: The stormy sea heaves as the waves crash against the shore.

meanings.sent1: He tried to heave the rock across the river but it fell short.
meanings.sent2: The quarterback heaves the football down the field to his receiver.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally heaved the ball through the window while playing catch.
meanings.sent4: The angry child heaved his toy across the room in a tantrum.
meanings.sent5: The lumberjack heaves the axe at the tree, aiming for the perfect spot.
